error.signature: TS2339: Property 'X' does not exist on type 'never'
error.regex: does not exist on type 'never'|Type 'never'.*not assignable

verdict.summary: A variable has been narrowed to never, meaning TypeScript thinks the code is unreachable. Usually caused by incomplete type guards.

dead_ends.action: Assert the variable as any to suppress the error
dead_ends.why_fails: The never type usually indicates a logic error; suppressing it hides real bugs

workarounds.action: Add an exhaustive check helper for discriminated unions
Fix the type narrowing that incorrectly narrows to never

leads_to.condition: When never type reveals missing union members

preceded_by.condition: When exhaustive switch narrows to never

frequently_confused_with.distinction: TS2339 on a regular type means property is missing; on never it means the code is unreachable or the type was over-narrowed
